document.masterDocTitle: A study on Roeslerstammiidae (Lepidoptera) in the Insect Collection of Nankai University (NKU), with descriptions of three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A study on Roeslerstammiidae (Lepidoptera) in the Insect Collection of Nankai University (NKU), with descriptions of three new species

bibRefCitation.author: Moriuti, S.
bibRefCitation.refString: Moriuti, S. (1978) Amphitheridae (Lepidoptera): four new species from Asia, Telethera blepharacma Meyrick new to Japan and Formosa, and Sphenograptis Meyrick transferred to the family. Bulletin of the University of Osaka Prefecture, Series B, 30, 1 - 17.

Diagnosis.
Agriothera elaeocarpophaga
is characterized by the absence of white mark on apical prominence of forewing ( Fig. 1 ). In the male genitalia ( Fig. 7 ), the broad median band formed by gnathal arms, the extremely narrowed and lengthened valva with a spine on distal margin, the U-shaped aedeagus.
Agriothera elaeocarpophaga
can be easily distinguished from its allies by above-mentioned characters.
Distribution. China ( Guangxi , Hainan , Taiwan , Yunnan), Japan , India ( Moriuti 1978 , 1982 ).
Remarks. This species is recorded from mainland China for the first time.
